listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A fully refurbished and beautifully presented two bedroom lower ground floor apartment, forming part of this recently renovated period conversion. This stunning flat has been refurbished to the highest standard with Parquet flooring and crushed velvet carpeting in the bedrooms. The flat has a fabulous south west facing 22'3 x 13'5 reception room with high ceilings, a large bay window and Audio/Visual and i-Light Systems (motion sensor activation and supplied iPad). This lateral flat also offers a 13'5 x 11'9 master bedroom suite with separate dressing room, an en-suite shower room and additional luxury bathroom/guest wc, both with underfloor heated luxury (Statuario marble with Philip Stark fittings). There is also a 13' x 12'9 second double bedroom, ample storage, additional vault space, double glazing and smart contemporary Hacker 13'9 kitchen with white quartz granite worktop and Siemens appliances.SituationRedcliffe Gardens is a wonderful tree lined avenue that enjoys all the amenities of both the Fulham Road and Old Brompton Road, whilst the nearest underground stations are Earl's Court and Gloucester Road (District, Circle and Piccadilly lines). With great access to both Hyde Park and the Cromwell Road (linking to M4), the central location is a real plus.Additional InformationThis property is being sold without the possibility of a Kensington & Chelsea parking permit.
listing.short_description: A fully refurbished and beautifully presented two bedroom lower ground floor apartment.

listing.description: A substantial and attractive 1930’s built family home which has been successfully extended, remodelled and improved, now offering very adaptable three storey accommodation. Due to specific circumstances the house has been extended to accommodate two families and is therefore slightly unusual.Currently, there is an impressive kitchen/dining/living room and adjacent to that is a second kitchen/dining/family room with two bedrooms and bathroom which is being used as a self-contained annexe. Alternatively, a quick glance at the floorplan will demonstrate that this area could be utilised differently. The kitchen could be removed and the room become the principal living room with the ground floor bedrooms used as reception rooms, as required. The rear extension has attractive ceiling lanterns in two of the rooms which provide excellent natural light and bi-fold doors open to the rear decking from the family area, living room and main ground floor bedroom.The first floor has a useful study area currently operating as an office with workstation, plus there are two bedrooms and shower room. The second floor has been converted into the master bedroom with twin wardrobe cupboards, stylish en-suite bathroom and there is a Juliet balcony. The house is superbly presented with fresh and modern décor, stylish contemporary bath/shower rooms (with rainhead showers, double cubicles and a free-standing bath to the en-suite bathroom) and kitchens which is balanced with some original features such as leaded light windows, although the extended rooms have double glazed leaded lights units.The main kitchen features numerous integrated appliances, induction hob, Corian worktops and high gloss units. There are also large porcelain tiles throughout the kitchen/dining/living room and the second kitchen/family room and off the main kitchen is a utility/boot room.Crystal chandeliers in all the main reception areas plus some rooms feature chrome downlighters and every room has chrome sockets, switches etc.Outside, is an adjacent garage, ample off road parking on a shingle driveway, whilst the substantial rear garden has a large timber decking, pergola, shed and lawn.The location is hugely convenient being within a half mile radius to Woking centre and station.Woking has a thriving town centre offering extensive shopping, dining and leisure facilities including The New Victoria Theatre & Cinema, and the Lightbox Gallery. For golfers there is a choice of clubs including, Woking Golf Club (one of the oldest in the U.K. Founded in 1893), Westhill, Hoebridge, Worplesdon, Chobham and Foxhills (including spa and hotel). Both the Basingstoke Canal and the River Wey are close by for walking, cycling and fishing (permit required), whilst nearby Chobham Common is a National Nature Reserve.The area is well served by both state and private schools including: Hoebridge, St Andrews, Greenfield, Halstead, Woking High School, St Dunstan’s and St John the Baptist School.Substantially Extended Aand Flexible AccommodationOpen plan Kitchen/Dining/Living RoomSecond Open Plan Kitchen/Dining/Family RoomTwo Ground Floor BedroomsGround Floor BathroomTwo First Floor Bedrooms And StudyFirst Floor Shower And CloakroomSecond Floor Master Bedroom With En-Suite Bathroom
listing.short_description: A substantial and attractive 1930’s built family home which has been successfully extended, remodelled and improved, now offering very adaptable three storey accommodation. (contd...)

listing.description: This stunning period mid-terrace property is situated in an enviable position close to Putney High Street and the River Thames, and has been beautifully maintained by the current owners.The accommodation comprises a warm and welcoming reception room with a fireplace and original period features. The hallway leads into a spacious dining room with a large storage cupboard and a modern, fully fitted kitchen. French doors open out on to a west-facing patio – perfect for enjoying the evening sun.Upstairs there are two good-sized double bedrooms, both with ample built-in storage and an immaculately presented bathroom with space for both a bath and shower. Access to the loft room is also on the floor which has the potential to extend and create a third bedroom, subject to the usual regulations and planning constraints.Being so central, the property is within easy reach of all the restaurants, bars and shops of Putney High Street. Additionally, with Putney Station 0.3 miles away and East Putney Station 0.6 miles away, access into Central London is easy, while for those wanting an alternative commute, the Thames Clipper departs from Putney Pier (0.3 miles) every 20-30 minutes.Vendors' comments: We've lived here for over 10 years and it's been a wonderful and happy home for us. The house has such a lovely feel and is a great space for relaxing, entertaining or general socialising.In location terms, it's perfect with shops, transport, eateries and drinkeries on the doorstep. With the river, common and park close by, it's been great for walking the dog, taking leisurely walks or other outdoor activities. The street has a real community feel with helpful and sociable neighbours, who are always happy to help each other out.We love this house and this lovely street, but due to work commitments it is time for us to move away. We know this will be a very happy home for another family in the near future.

listing.description: Description"Isherwood Fold House" an exceptional example of a period property blending old and new to create a high calibre family residence. Built circa 1800 this stone detached property is grade II listed and retains many original features including stone fireplaces, stone mullion windows and beamed ceilings to name just a few. The property sits on a private and well established plot but is not isolated or secluded. Being approached from Isherwood Fold, off Blackburn Road, Edgworth, there are neighbours nearby but they are not in any way intrusive. Located within easy reach of open countryside and Entwistle & the Wayho Reservoir perfect for tranquil walks. In addition within the catchment area for highly regarded Schools and transport links.Briefly comprising: Entrance hall, lounge, dining room, sitting room, impressive breakfast kitchen, utility room, study, mezzanine lounge, bedroom 5,3 piece en suite, first floor: Landing, three double bedrooms (bedroom 2 with dressing room and 3 piece en suite shower room, spacious family 4 piece bathroom, second floor: Spacious master suite including 5 piece bathroom. Outside are spacious and professionally landscaped gardens with various lawns and patio areas. A large cobbled driveway leads to two integrated garages.This property would suite the most discerning of buyers with internal inspection a must!

listing.description: Kirklees Hall is a superior Grade I listed building that has been sympathetically renovated during the 1990's to create a select few, grand yet comfortable homes set in large, well maintained grounds. Carr House is a five bedroom property situated within this prestigious country house estate and has the advantage of countryside living with local motorway access as well as beautiful period features throughout and a fascinating history.Set over three levels this property briefly comprises: Grand entrance hall with double 'flying' staircase by Carr of York (one of the Country's most highly regarded Georgian architects), large drawing/living room with oak panels, grand dining room and high quality dining kitchen. To the first floor there is a double bedroom with additional children's bedroom/dressing room off, further double bedroom with long distance views and large master bedroom which is currently used as living area. There are two bathrooms and guest suite to the lower ground with two bedrooms, bathroom including sauna with additional store rooms and cellar.Leeds and Manchester accessible via M62 motorway (Leeds approx. 15 miles, Manchester approx. 33 miles).Kirklees Hall was built in the 16th Century by Sir Thomas Gargrave and then bought by the Armytage family shortly after. The foundations on the original hall (Carr House) were taken from the old Kirklees Priory, which stood only 100 meters from the hall, and was demolished by Cromwell during the Protestant/Catholic turmoil. There is evidence that Charlotte Bronte frequently visited Kirklees Hall, and the hall is mentioned in some of her books. In the grounds of Kirklees Hall estate is the grave of Robin Hood. It is said that his Aunt was the prioress of the priory and was known for her healing powers by way of blood letting.
listing.short_description: Kirklees Hall is a superior Grade I listed building that has been sympathetically renovated during the 1990’s to create a select few, grand yet comfortable homes set in large, well maintained grounds. Carr House is a five bedroom property situated within this prestigious country house estate and has the advantage of countryside living with local motorway access as well as beautiful period features throughout and a fascinating history.

listing.description: SummaryIf you are looking for a house with a wow factor then look no further the property has lots of flexible uses and is currently run as a viable bed and breakfast, an early viewing is essential to appreciate what this property has to offer!DescriptionThis beautiful stone built detached family home with income opportunity, together with additional self contained letting accommodation that could suit a variety of purposes or convert to a separate annexe ( subject to consent). The beautifully presented accommodation of the main house measures a generous 2995 sq ft and incorporates a spacious reception hall, c.27' sitting room complete with wood burner, spacious kitchen / breakfast room, study, cloakroom along with a large dining room, which is currently used for guests and a second kitchen. To the first floor is a large master bedroom with en-suite bathroom, four further double bedrooms, each with an en-suite, plus a large family bathroom. The additional self contained letting accommodation is situated at the other end of the driveway and comprises eight rooms in total each with en-suite facilities plus an additional kitchenette/laundry room. At 1222 sq ft, subject to planning, this building could be converted to a self contained annexe for multi generational family living. listing.description: Refined in style, Beech House is an impressive double-fronted family home featuring a spacious central hall. Its extensive kitchen and breakfast/family room offers open plan luxury, with French doors and a separate utility room leading outside to the detached triple garage. The sophisticated sitting room also features French doors, while the dining room and study are light and airy, thanks to large bay windows. The master bedroom boasts a private dressing room, accompanied by two more en suite bedrooms and two additional bedrooms, ensuring a sanctuary for everyone.About FoxhillsAway from Birmingham's urban sprawl lies the tranquil and affluent commuter village of Barnt Green, where our exclusive collection of mews, semi-detached homes, detached homes and apartments combine luxury living with laid-back rural charm.Boasting light and contemporary interiors, each two, three, four and five bedroom home offers all the space and high specification you're looking for. And with the city centre just 10 miles away, as well as a choice of local amenities and well-regarded schools on its leafy doorstep, the most fantastic lifestyle can be enjoyed at Foxhills.Even though Barnt Green is a mere 10 miles south of Birmingham, it retains a rural feel thanks to Lickey Hills Country Park, which over looks the village, Situated in the Bromsgrove district of Worcestershire, it's always been a haven for commuters who can benefit from a caf?, delicatessen, butcher, florist and a variety of restaurants and pubs on the high street just under half-a-mile from Foxhills. For more active pursuits, Barnt Green Sports Club offers tennis, badminton, squash and table tennis, while the Cricket Club is next door to Foxhills. You can also go walking, cycling and fishing at Cofton Hackett and Bittell Reservoirs alongside the Worcester and Birmingham canal. Foxhills is equally well-placed for a high standard of education, with excellent choices like St Andrew?S C.E. First School, Alvechurch C.E. Middle School and South Bromsgrove High School.Opening HoursIn the case of inclement weather, please call ahead. Sales office and showhome open Thursday to Tuesday from 10:30am to 5pm and 12.30pm to 5pm on Wednesdays.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property with Currell, please be aware that fees will apply during the process. Details of these fees are as follows:

Administration Fees (Non-optional)
We charge £240 (including VAT) to cover the cost of administration of the tenancy. For clarity, this is a charge per tenancy and not per applicant.

Referencing Fees (Non-optional)
We use an independent referencing agency (rmt - Reference-My-Tenant) to carry out reference checks on all tenants. The cost of these checks are £40 (including VAT) per individual joining the tenancy and £50 (including VAT) if a company is being referenced. For clarity, each individual named in the tenancy agreement will need to pay a referencing fee. For example, 3 tenants = 3 referencing fees.

Check-In Fees (Non optional in the event that the Landlord uses the services of an Independent Inventory Clerk)
We use an independent inventory company (normally Ready Report) to carry out a Check-In and Check-Out service on all properties (subject to the landlord confirming that they wish to use this service). The cost of a check-in and check-out are identical and can vary from £108 (including VAT) to £240 (including VAT) dependent on the size of property and the amount of furnishings in the property. Most normally, tenants pay for a check-in and landlords pay for the check-out. For clarity, check in fees are payable per tenancy, not per applicant.

Early Termination (Non-optional in the event of leaving earlier than the tenancy allows)

A fundamental responsibility as a tenant is to pay your rent, but we recognize there may be circumstances whereby you need to break out of your tenancy early. If your Landlord agrees that the property can be re advertised, in order to find a suitable replacement tenant to take over your liability, you still need to continue making your regular rent payments until a new tenant takes occupation. In addition you will need to cover the Landlords fees for the unexpired term of your tenancy. These fees are calculated on a pro rata basis. Should you be thinking of leaving earlier than your tenancy agreement permits, you should contact your local branch as soon as possible for a detailed breakdown of the costs involved.

Other Fees

Currell also works on behalf of institutional, rather than private, Landlords who may have their own administration procedures and fees. This can mean that the costs vary from those detailed above. Details of these fees are available upon request, but please be assured that if these landlords charge fees then you will not be liable to pay any fees to us.

listing.short_description:
Rails House Farm is a substantial stone built Farm House offering extensive luxury accommodation with stunning far-reaching views across the Rivelin Valley.

Standing in approximately four acres of gardens, grounds and paddocks and set well back from Rails Road via a long tarmacked driveway with adjacent enclosed fields. This splendid property has a fabulous mix of traditional and contemporary with heavy oak beams, feature stone walls and having the benefit of a stylish interior with timber double glazing and under floor heating.

Ideally located on the edge of the Peak District National Park with all the advantages of country living, within a commutable distance to Manchester and Leeds, yet having a short drive to Sheffield’s city centre and to local amenities situated at Redmires and Crosspool.

With a self-contained annexe in the attached stable block, having a mezzanine and bedroom which could be utilised as a wonderful home office/studio or self-contained living accommodation for a dependant relative.

The property comprises on the ground floor: Living room, utility room, shower room, bedroom 4/study, breakfast kitchen, pantry, snug, lounge, attached annexe, and lounge (annexe).

On the first floor: Landing, master bedroom, dressing area, en-suite shower room, bedroom 2, en-suite shower room, bedroom 3, en-suite shower room, Mezzanine level (Annexe Bedroom 5) and Bathroom (Annexe Bathroom).

Ground Floor

Living Room (8.2m x 6.0m (26'10" x 19'8"))

With front facing timber double glazed windows, part-glazed front entrance door, tiled flooring with under floor heating, recessed/ornamental lighting, attractive timber roof lantern, illuminated steps with a contemporary brushed steel hand rail, wall mounted video entry system and telephone. Having a light and spacious seating area with provision for a wall mounted TV and ample space for a large dining table and chairs.

Doors lead off to the:

Utility Room (2.5m x 2.4m (8'2" x 7'10"))

With tiled flooring, under floor heating, fitted open shelving and having space for a fridge freezer and plumbing for an automatic washing machine. Access can be gained to the roof void, which houses the central heating boiler and hot water tank.

Shower Room

Being Fully tiled and having a side facing timber double glazed window and deep sill, chrome heated towel rail, extractor fan and under floor heating. With a suite in white comprising a low level WC, wall mounted wash hand basin with chrome taps and a Bristan shower enclosure with glazed door.

Bedroom 4/Study (4.8m x 3.1m (15'8" x 10'2"))

A spacious room with a side facing timber double glazed window, under floor heating, pendant light points, skirtings, telephone and TV aerial points. The room could also be utilised as a fourth bedroom.

Breakfast Kitchen (6.9m x 5.5m (22'7" x 18'0"))

Three side facing timber double glazed windows bathe this wonderful kitchen with ample natural light. With a feature beamed ceiling, tiled flooring with under floor heating, TV aerial point, pan drawer and recessed lighting. Having a comprehensive range of base/wall and drawer units, plate rack, display shelving and granite work surfaces. Having a central breakfast bar island and a stainless 1.5 bowl sink with chrome mixer tap and soap dispenser. Appliances include a built-in aeg dishwasher, fridge/freezer and a freestanding Rangemaster 5 ring cooker with 2 ovens, hot plate and extractor fan over.

Leading off from the breakfast kitchen are stairs with a double glazed window and having attractive turned spindles with a quarter turn leading to the first floor landing.

Pantry

Having tiled flooring, under floor heating, fitted shelving and a small timber double glazed window.

Snug (4.1m x 3.6m (13'5" x 11'9"))

With a front facing timber double glazed window, deep oak panelled window seat, additional eye-level rear facing timber double glazed window with attractive oak panelled flooring, under floor heating, feature beamed ceiling, recessed lighting and wall light points. A timber door and two steps lead to the:

Lounge (10.2m x 3.6m (33'5" x 11'9"))

This wonderfully light and airy reception room has stunning far reaching views over the grounds and surrounding countryside. Having front facing timber double glazed doors with matching side panels giving access to the stone flagged terrace with additional front and rear facing timber double glazed windows with matching double glazed panels. With attractive engineered oak flooring, central heating radiator, fitted display shelving, deep skirtings, recessed lighting and a wall mounted video entry system.

Attached Annexe (8.9m x 5.3m (29'2" x 17'4"))

This area of great potential is accessed from the relaxed seating area in the entrance hall and has been sympathetically converted into a self contained Annexe.

Lounge (Annexe)

A spacious living area with timber double glazed windows to the front and side, timber double glazed doors opening to the front and heavy beamed vaulted ceiling. Also having wall lights in brushed aluminium, recessed lighting, underfloor heating and a timber staircase rising to the mezzanine level.

Mezzanine Level (Annexe Bedroom 5) (5.3m x 4.4m (17'4" x 14'5"))

With a heavy beamed vaulted ceiling and small Velux style roof window.

A doorway leads to:

Bathroom (Annexe Bathroom)

A half tiled bathroom with a Velux roof window, ceiling light point and chrome heated towel rail. Having a suite in white comprising low level WC, wall mounted wash hand basin with chrome mixer taps and vanity storage beneath and a panelled bath in white high gloss with chrome mixer tap. Additionally there are two further roof storage areas.

First Floor

Landing

Having two attractive stained glass double glazed windows with an additional timber double glazed window to the rear.

Master Bedroom Suite

Master Bedroom (10.3m x 3.6m (33'9" x 11'9"))

Front and side facing timber double glazed windows and a feature timber double glazed coach window provide ample natural light and stunning views from this superb bedroom. With additional Velux roof windows, recessed lighting, vaulted and feature beamed ceilings, exposed feature stone wall, attractive oak flooring, under floor heating, and having a range of fitted wardrobes in soft cream with hanging rails.

Dressing Area

With fitted hanging rails and cupboards over.

A door leads to the:

En-Suite Shower Room

With a front facing timber double glazed window, under floor heating, recessed lighting, chrome heated towel rail, extractor fan and shaver point. Being fully tiled and having a suite in white comprising a low level WC, bidet and wash stand with chrome mixer tap. There is a double width Image Ultra shower enclosure with a Bristan rain head shower, separate hand shower facility and glazed door.

Bedroom 2 (3.8m x 3.4m (12'5" x 11'1"))

With a front facing timber double glazed window and deep sill, recessed lighting, deep skirtings, fitted wash hand basin with taps and vanity cupboards and drawers. Having a range of fitted furniture with decorative lighting over and central heating radiator. There is also provision for a wall mounted TV with an aerial point.

A door leads to the:

En-Suite Shower Room

Fully tiled with under floor heating, recessed lighting, extractor fan and chrome heated towel rail. Having a suite in white, which comprises a low level WC, corner shower enclosure with chrome shower and sliding glazed doors.

Bedroom 3 (3.8m x 3.1m (12'5" x 10'2"))

With two rear facing timber double glazed windows one with a deep sill, feature beamed and vaulted ceiling, built-in loft access, recessed lighting, central heating radiator and fitted open shelving. A wash hand basin in white with taps is set within a roll edged work surface with fitted vanity cupboards below. There is also provision for a wall mounted TV with an aerial point.

En-Suite Shower Room

Fully tiled with under floor heating, Velux roof window, recessed lighting, chrome heated towel rail and extractor fan. A suite in white comprises a low level WC, corner shower enclosure with fitted shower and sliding glazed doors.

Exterior

Rails House Farm stands in extensive grounds and is accessed via electrically operated wrought iron gates controlled by a video intercom system. A long, sweeping driveway leads to the front of the property where there is a feature stone turning circle and hard standing area with light and power and having parking for several vehicles. Approximately 4 acres of grazing/agricultural land adjoin the property the majority of which is to the rear and to the side, all being enclosed with dry stonewalling. The front and rear gardens are mainly laid to lawn and there is a fabulous stone flagged patio/seating area with external lighting and water tap. There’s a large barn, which is ideal for storage with an additional shelter situated in the largest field. The current owners obtained planning permission in 2008 for the erection of a double garage with office space above; this has since lapsed but may be reconsidered by the local authority.

Viewing's

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.

listing.description: This fabulous four double bedroom family home is positioned in a great location and has substantial floor space. Upon entry the property benefits from a wide entry hallway which then leads to two separate reception rooms with high ceilings, one with conservatory adjoining leading onto the garden. There is a large eat in kitchen with plentiful storage space which is perfect for family living as is the ground floor cloakroom.On the first floor you will find four double bedrooms with two bathrooms, one which is an en-suite shower room. The property is light and bright and has a wonderful established sunny and private south facing garden benefitting from side access, there is also a shed complete with electricity supply, which allows for ample storage and the property has off street parking at the front.Telford Avenue is located in the Telford Park Conservation area, close to the local amenities, shops, bars and restaurants of Streatham Hill and Balham. There is a great community with an active residents association and the popular Telford Lawn Tennis Club. Brixton is also close-by and easily accessible.Streatham Hill National Rail Station and Balham National Rail station also offers great transport links to London Bridge, Clapham Junction, Victoria, Waterloo and Gatwick Airport. Balham Underground station (Northern Line) provides quick access to the City and West End. While local bus routes give further connections to Victoria Line (Brixton) and central London.

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.

listing.description: A fantastic opportunity to purchase a newly refurbished family home, beautifully presented and finished to a high standard.This fabulous three story house has a large front garden and is set back from the road. Stepping into the house, the hallway leads through to a large open plan kitchen/reception room, with the living space to the front of the property and a fantastic fitted kitchen to the rear, with ample dining space and double doors which lead out to a low maintenance and private garden. At the rear of the garden there is secure access to a garage from private gates on Dalebury road, which is excellent for parking or as an additional storage space. On the first floor there are two good sized double bedrooms and a family bathroom with a beautiful four piece suite, including a separate walk-in shower. The top floor accommodates a further two double bedrooms served by another modern bathroom. The house has double glazed windows throughout with secondary glazing and plantation shutters to the front. The loft is boarded providing additional storage space. There is also underfloor heating in both bathrooms.Located on Trinity Road on the corner of Dalebury Road this is a highly desirable location offering easy access to both Tooting Bec underground station and Wandsworth Common mainline station. The shops, bars and restaurants that are popular along Bellevue Road are close by as are the local amenities of Balham High Road, and those surrounding Tooting Bec station. The green open spaces of Wandsworth Common are also within close proximity.

At the rear of the garden there is secure access to a garage from private gates on Dalebury road, which is excellent for parking or as an additional storage space. On the first floor there are two good sized double bedrooms and a family bathroom with a beautiful four piece suite, including a separate walk-in shower. The top floor accommodates a further two double bedrooms served by another modern bathroom. The house has double glazed windows throughout with secondary glazing and plantation shutters to the front. The loft is boarded providing additional storage space. There is also underfloor heating in both bathrooms. Located on Trinity Road on the corner of Dalebury Road this is a highly desirable location offering easy access to both Tooting Bec underground station and Wandsworth Common mainline station. The shops, bars and restaurants that are popular along Bellevue Road are close by as are the local amenities of Balham High Road, and those surrounding Tooting Bec station. The green open spaces of Wandsworth Common are also within close proximity.

listing.description: This area looks to the south-west which allows for maximum natural light. The parquet flooring is a herringbone style and made from solid oak. The doorways feature 4 and 6 panel bespoke doors with the heights being raised to further enhance the proportions. To further add to the character of the building, original cast iron radiators have been re-installed throughout and louvered bespoke shutters.The kitchen has been fitted with a premium range from Hacker Classic and is fitted with high quality Siemen appliances including oven, fridge/freezer, hob, dishwasher, washer/dryer and extractor unit. The worktops have been cut from high quality stone quartz.The bedroom accommodation comprises large master suite with beautiful en suite bathroom and generous dressing room. The large second double bedroom benefits from large fitted cupboards and having a southerly aspect. There is a further bathroom and storage cupboard located off the hallway.This apartment has a very large storage area to the front of the accommodation which has been fully tanked to keep it dry and would make an exceptional wine cellar. There is a private courtyard to the rear which has been decked with the highest quality cedar wood.The apartment has audio visual, mood lighting, and a heating system which all have a number of settings to suit the environment and can be accessed and programmed through an iPad or iPhone (An iPad is provided for the property). The accommodation is wired with cat 6 cabling, wall speakers in the bedrooms, living room and dining area to allow any future owner to easily choose their preferred system.Redcliffe Gardens is situated in Chelsea, SW10. The street consists mainly terraced and semi-detached Victorian house built c1860. The area was originally dominated by farmland prior to the building development and was previously referred to as, 'Walnut Tree Walk'.The nearest rail stations are Earl's Court (District, Circle, Piccadilly Lines) and West Brompton (Overground). The A4 is very close by for those motorists looking for easy access out of London.
listing.short_description: An exceptional two-bedroom apartment having been superbly refurbished to an extremely high standard by the current owners.

listing.description: James Pendleton are thrilled to introduce to the market another of the stunning Fulham Riverside development by Barratt Homes. The property boasts two generously proportioned double bedrooms, two immaculately finished bathrooms and a modern open plan living space.The interior of the apartment is brand new and finished to the highest of standards. The clean, contemporary kitchen spans the entire width of the open plan reception room and has integrated Siemens appliances and a wine cooler, as well as a built-in sound system that can be found in the ceilings of the bedroom and kitchen/reception, compatible for use with both television and Hi-Fi. Television, internet and sound system access points have been prepared by the developers. Throughout the apartment state of the art Comfort Cooling systems are present. The private balcony offers ample space for entertaining and stunning views of the River. Both the family and master en-suite bathrooms are tastefully finished in a neutral décor alongside contemporary fittings that are in keeping with the rest of the interior. Similar to the reception space; the master bedroom has large windows giving a light and airy feel. The property further benefits from a secure entry phone to the flat, a 24 hour concierge, and exquisite communal areas which have been finished in granite. The apartment is offered for sale to include allocated parking and all fixtures and fittings.Fulham Riverside’s location allows residents to walk to Chelsea and is also an ideal location for Wandsworth Bridge Road with its abundance of boutiques, furniture shops, vibrant bars and restaurants being only moments away. Imperial Wharf is also a short walk away, and Wandsworth Town mainline station with its links to Clapham Junction and Waterloo. Numerous bus routes operate on Townmead Road and Wandsworth Bridge Road.

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.

The accommodation upstairs comprises of a top floor bedroom with a separate shower room and family bathroom serving the other three bedrooms on the first floor. The house has the benefit of retaining some of the character fireplaces & the Victorian sash windows and is in need of some cosmetic updating so absolutely ideal for those wishing to add their own stamp! Brocklebank Road is quietly situated in this pretty enclave of roads within walking distance of Earlsfield mainline station, excellent bus routes are also close by. Earlsfield has a great choice of diverse restaurants, bars & local shops, with more extensive shopping & leisure facilities on offer in nearby Wandsworth Town. Local primary schools are excellent and the open spaces of Wandsworth common are close by so a great family orientated area.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A delightful family house with very attractive front and rear elevations originally believed to have been built in 1898 and completed in 1904 and with only 4 owners since. The property houses many fine features, some of which include:• An impressive solid wood double front door with stained glass inserts opening into a panelled porch with large cloakroom and door to the reception hall.• An elegant drawing room with a beautiful square bay window to the rear looking out to the garden, an open fireplace with shelving fitted to either side of the chimney breast and ornate bi-folding glass doors to the sitting room which can be opened to bring the two rooms together.• A very well proportioned dining room with an attractive fireplace with gas fire and outlooks across the garden.• A lovely and well equipped kitchen/breakfast room fitted with long black granite worktops, bespoke solid wood cupboards and drawers, an island unit, and a door to a pantry, useful boot room and utility room fitted with identical units to those in the kitchen.• To the first floor the principal bedroom suite has fantastic outlooks of the garden with a stunning square bay window with ornate detailing. An adjacent dressing room, which also has its own door to the landing and so could be an additional bedroom, is fitted with a bank of wardrobes and gives access to an en suite bathroom. There are two further bedrooms on this floor which are very well served by an extremely well fitted family bathroom with under floor heating and large walk-in shower. To the top floor are two inter-connecting bedrooms and a further bedroom which is currently used as an office.SituationThe property is situated almost equidistant between Crowborough Beacon Golf Club and Crowborough town centre which offers good shopping facilities including Waitrose and Morrisons supermarkets. There are schools for children of all ages in the area and other than the golf course, recreational amenities in the town include a sports and leisure centre and tennis and squash club. The miles of open heath land on Ashdown Forest is nearby and Tunbridge Wells is about 9 miles to the north for excellent shopping facilities and amenities. Train Services: Crowborough station at Jarvis Brook or Eridge Station for trains to London Bridge.OutsideTo the side of the house a gravel driveway provides parking and turning for several vehicles and in turn leads to a detached double garage with two ‘up & over doors’ and a personal door to the side. To the rear, the gardens are excellent being mainly lawn with many established shrub beds and by the house, a south facing flagstone terrace provides a lovely spot in which to sit, dine and entertain. The gardens are very well screened with mature hedging and trees and there is also a vegetable garden, fruit cages, 2 greenhouses and a number of sheds. In all about 0.64 acres.Additional InformationTrain Services Crowborough station at Jarvis Brook for a direct service to London Bridge in about 1 hour or Tunbridge Wells mainline station for trains to Charing Cross and Cannon Street in about 50/55minutes.ServicesGas fired central heating, mains water, drainage and electric

listing.description: An outstanding Edwardian property, in excess of 3,000 sq ft, set on a beautiful landscaped plot almost fully secluded from its neighbouring properties. Whilst the house would have been built for single family occupants around the turn of the century it has been subsequently converted and extended to incorporate five unique, individual and highly desirable apartments.5 Westray Hall is an exceptionally spacious, exquisitely finished and opulent self-contained ground floor mansion style apartment located in the heart of the highly prestigious and very sought after West Overcliff area of Bournemouth. The apartment has been newly renovated and refurbished to what is, in our opinion, thehighest of standards and sits in 0.5 acres of beautifully landscaped irrigated gardens that boast sumptuous lawns, floral borders, mature shrubbery and beautiful established trees.The town centres of Bournemouth and Westbourne providing superb restaurant, entertainment and shopping facilities are within one mile in either direction and the famous cliff tops with their famous Chines and pathways leading down to the award winning beaches are only a short walk of a few hundred metres.The property benefits from the original grand entrance to the building and incorporates versatile accommodation as detailed on the attached floor plan.There are an exceptional number of outstanding features to the property, too numerous to list individually. Perhaps the overwhelming theme of the property is the outlook and access onto the surrounding private garden area.The stunning kitchen has a range of high gloss black contemporary fitted units with a quartz work surface and integrated Neff appliances. The breakfast room/family room benefits from retractable doors which lead to the south facing patio area.There are three formal living room areas and a grand formal dining room.A fabulous feature of the drawing room is an original fully working character fireplace with inset marble back and slate hearth. This room also benefits from retractable bi-fold doors which lead to the side patio area.The formal dining room has a log burner effect gas fire which utilises steam as smoke and retractablebi-fold doors leading to the landscaped gardens.The master bedroom has a garden outlook and direct access to a west facing patio. It also benefitsfrom a fabulous en-suite, separate wet room and WC.There are three guest bedrooms, all of which are good size rooms and all benefit from luxurious en-suite facilities.Externally the property benefits from a simply fabulous garden area which has various access points. The main body of the garden is laid to lawn and is positioned to the south and south easterly sides of the property. The manicured lawns have exceptionally well stocked flower, tree and mature shrub borders. A computerised fully automated irrigation system ensures that the garden is fairly low maintenance. A private footpath givesaccess to the West Overcliff which in turn leads down to the local safe and sandy beaches at Alum Chine.Two main features of the garden are a heated outdoor swimming pool and a bespoke built summer house with timber tiled roof and seating for up to 12 people with power and light, ideal for al fresco dining.A garage with an electrically operated up and over door and two allocated parking spacesare conveyed with apartment.

listing.description: An individual detached 1960's built chalet style home in a delightful semi rural location of the north west outskirts of the town enjoying magnificent panoramic rear views over the valley towards Munday Dean. Offering flexible accommodation together with an adjoining large detached garage with scope to convert into ancillary accommodation (subject to p.P) and two driveways providing ample parking.LocationFrieth Road is situated within 2 miles from the High Street, with its array of bustling individual shops, cafes and restaurants, and within easy reach of the Station (London Paddington via Maidenhead with Crossrail due in 2019) and the motorway network for the commuter via the Marlow bypass A404, with fast access to the M40 at J4 Handy Cross, & the M4 at J8/9 Maidenhead. Local leisure facilities include golf at Harleyford and Temple; rowing at Marlow Rowing Club; riding walking and cycling in the Hambleden Valley; clubs for hockey, tennis, cricket & bowls all in Pound Lane, as well as the Court Gardens Leisure complex and the National Sports Centre at Bisham Abbey.DirectionsFrom the centre of Marlow, proceed west from the obelisk along West Street towards Henley. Turn right at Platts garage into Oxford Road and continue in Chalkpit Lane. Climb the hill, continue through Bovingdon Green and continue onto the Frieth Road. Proceed along the Frieth Road for approximately 1 mile where the property will be found on the right hand side.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A five bedroom detached family home of character and substantial proportions with integral garage. The property sits comfortably in just over a third of an acre and has the advantage of a south west facing gardens. This lovely home has well balanced accommodation extending to 2379 sq ft and enjoys a contemporary, spacious kitchen/ breakfast area with fitted aeg appliances including wine cooler, double oven and 5 ring hob, coffee machine and fridge freezer. The adjacent utility room has a door in to the garden and space for appliances. The elegant living room is light and airy with gas coal effect feature fireplace and doors in to the back garden. There is a family room, cloakroom and study that completes the layout. The first floor accommodation comprises five bedrooms, two en-suites and a family bathroom. The master bedroom benefits from a good selection of built in wooden wardrobes and pretty bay window to the front.SituationSituated off a semi rural no through road on the borders of Whyteleafe and Caterham, Greenacres enjoys an enviable, peaceful position overlooking paddocks, in an area designated 'Wooded Hillside' and surrounded by beautiful Greenbelt countryside. Kenley Aerodrome (gliders only) and Kenley Common are both nearby, offering acres of country walks and rural seclusion. The town of Caterham, lies about 2 miles to the south and offers shopping, leisure and transport facilities. There are a selection of schools for boys and girls of all ages in both the state and independent sectors, including the renowned Caterham School.OutsideThe property is set back from the road approached via a sweeping driveway providing parking for several cars. There is a covered porch, side access to the rear and double garage that benefits from electrically operated doors, light and power. The landscaped gardens are enclosed by close-boarded fencing and are mainly laid to lawn to just over a third of an acre. There are well stocked borders filled with mature evergreen shrubs and trees.
listing.short_description: Five bedroom detached family home of character and substantial proportions with integral garage. The property sits comfortably in just over a third of an acre and has the advantage of a south west facing garden situated along a tree lined lane with views over paddocks, convenient for train station.

listing.description: This highly individual apartment occupies the ground floor at Westray Hall, benefiting from a private front door. It is also conveyed with the major portion of the rear garden, forming a beautiful and highly impressive setting for the mansion-style living accommodation. The reception hall opens onto an informal reception / sitting area and the formal sitting room is perfect for entertaining with doors opening onto a rear sun terrace and an extremely well concealed cinema system, incorporating a remote control drop down cinema projector and a motorised screen above the period fireplace. There are four en-suite bedrooms, the master being the most impressive with a sumptuous bathroom and doors opening onto a rear sun terrace.The remaining accommodation includes a contemporary fitted kitchen, informal dining and an additional feature split-level dining room with a vaulted ceiling and a conservatory. The fixtures and fittings have been the subject of a no-expense-spared fit out by one of the area's leading interior designers, although many of the fine period features have been retained. The style of the apartment is undoubtedly one of grandeur with high ceilings, deep skirtings, moulded architraves pediments over many doors all of which are skillfully combined with mod cons such as an integrated sound system with concealed ceiling speakers by local specialists Dawsons.SituationThe West Cliff Conservation Area is one of the most exclusive enclaves of Bournemouth. It retains much of its Edwardian charm and the cliff top sea views, zig-zags and chines remain part of its attraction. The shopping centres of Bournemouth and Westbourne are nearby and the well-known Sandbanks Peninsula is only a short drive away. The larger area is home to a number of health spas and golf clubs and Poole Harbour is a mecca for watersports enthusiasts and is also home to a number of yacht clubs.OutsideThe grounds are something of a one-off and they are privately maintained by the current owners although there is an automatic irrigation system. The overall effect is very pleasing and there is a rather attractive ornamental oak which is though to have some age. Unusually, the grounds include a private swimming pool and a pavilion, which benefits from patio heaters and piped music. There is a single garage near to the entrance of the apartment with extra demised space for visitor and casual parking.
listing.short_description: A highly individual garden apartment situated in the west cliff conservation area - exceptionally spacious (3444 sq ft) - 4 en suite bedrooms - many period features - mansion style living - own private entrance - private swimming pool within grounds - close to beaches

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.

In addition to the upfront Rent and Deposit which are typically 1 calendar month and 6 weeks respectively, a tenancy fee of £140 per person, plus a charge of £55 per person for personal referencing is payable.

Typically you will be asked to put down 2 weeks in Rent as a ‘fee of intent’ plus the referencing and administration costs – these are then deducted from the ‘move-in’ monies as outlined above.

If you wish to renew your contract, there will be a renewal admin fee of £60 per person. If the identity of a tenant changes, assignment documentation must be drawn up and signed, for which the cost is £350 plus referencing costs and a £25 deposit re- registration fee.

In the event that you and the landlord agree to early termination of your contract then you will need to mitigate the Landlord against any loss of fees.

At the end of your tenancy, there is a check out charge currently ranging from £84 for a one bedroom furnished apartment to £102 for a 4 bed furnished apartment.

listing.description: South of The River are proud to present for sale this beautifully presented 2 bed room flat. Situated in one of the music industries most iconic buildings, this is a rare opportunity to purchase a piece of musical history. Rough trade records was founded by Geoff Travis in 1976 as a full time business in the vinyl record sales market and achieved huge success and accolade.Travis and Rough Trade originally sold Northern Soul records in it's beginning and brought Northern Soul to the South of England, amongst many other up and coming music style's and bands. However it was the generational change which brought the launch of Punk Rock and put Rough Trade on the map when it came to being a major player in the growing music scene.Rough Trade signed many bands and distributed their records for sale, at the same time setting up what became known as 'The Cartel', an independent network of independent record labels who could distribute their music to the public.This iconic flat carries it's history far and wide, famous for it's links in the industry with bands such as #The Smiths, #Scritti Politti, #The #Babyshambles, #The Libertines, #Anastacia, #Arcade Fire, #Jarvis Cocker, #The Strokes, #Stiff Little Fingers and #Anthony and the #Johnsons, just a handful of musical influences who have reigned from this iconic building and record label.

listing.description: This unique property, which sits on Edwardian brick arches, overlooks its own private riverside garden and pontoon. On the other side of the river is an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a working dairy farm.Until c.1950 the house was occupied by the Wallingford ferryman, who transported horses, people and freight across the river at the point where the River Thames tow path changed sides. The raised outhouse was the ticket booth associated with the ferry.The house is on the southern edge of the pretty medieval market town of Wallingford, situated along the banks of the River Thames. The centre of the town is a five minute walk along either the riverside or quiet roads, and has a picturesque town square with a 17th century arcaded town hall, a number of historic inns and restaurants, three ancient churches, the Corn Exchange theatre and cinema, a large Waitrose and a summer outdoor swimming pool.Just over an hour's drive from London, 15 minutes from Henley and 20 minutes from Oxford. Enjoy the Cholsey and Wallingford Steam Railway, or a walk around the ruins of Wallingford Castle, once one of the largest in the country but largely destroyed by Oliver Cromwell. There is a town museum in Wallingford and Agatha Christie's home and boathouse nearby. Nearby places include Silverstone, Towester Racecourse and Stowe Gardens. Blenheim Palace, the birthplace of Sir Winston Churchill and the spectacular city of Oxford are in close proximity.
listing.short_description: A beautiful and historic ferryman's cottage offering two bedrooms and versatile accommodation. The site of which is mentioned in Jerome K. Jerome's Three Men in a Boat, which is situated directly on the banks of the River Thames, adjacent to the Oxford University Rowing Club. The property would make a fantastic lock up and leave or holiday let investment.
